row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: AEA/ASSA meetings, federal recovery programs, online services

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Final Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2008
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 0.5 percent after increasing 2.8 percent in the second quarter. Prices paid by U.S. residents increased 4.5 percent after increasing 4.2 percent, reflecting accelerated food prices.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Third Quarter of 2008
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Toward Better Measurement of Innovation and Intangibles
row.Author: Ana M. Aizcorbe, Carol E. Moylan, Carol A. Robbins
row.Description: This briefing discusses BEA's ongoing efforts to better measure investment in innovative activity and intangible assets. It notes the progress and the challenges of measuring investment in specific areas, such as research and development.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Third Quarter of 2008
row.Author: Douglas B. Weinberg, Renee M. Sauers
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $6.9 billion to $174.1 billion in the third quarter from $180.9 billion in the second quarter; the surpluses on income and services increased, and the deficit on goods and net unilateral current transfers to foreigners decreased.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account, 1998–2007
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: This annual supplement to the international transactions accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade and net receipts of affiliates of multinational companies.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: Tina C. Highfill, David G. Lenze, Mauricio Ortiz
row.Description: The inaugural version of this report offers highlights of state personal income statistics for the third quarter of 2008 and county compensation statistics by industry for 2005–2007.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A new look at the terms of trade; BEA at the AEA/ASSA meetings

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2008
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 3.8 percent after decreasing 0.5 percent in the third quarter, reflecting a downturn in exports and a much larger decrease in investment in equipment and software. In 2008, real GDP increased 1.3 percent after increasing 2.0 percent.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: The 2008 Financial Crisis and the National Accounts

row.Title: How BEA Accounts for Investment in Private Structures
row.Author: Paul R. Lally
row.Description: A guide to an important component of private business investment: structures. This article also discusses recent improvements to these statistics, which now better reflect productivity and quality changes.

row.Title: A New Approach to Price Measures for Health Care(
row.Author: Shelly Smith
row.Description: A look into the ongoing research at BEA toward developing price indexes that reflect the effects of substitution in health care spending. The new indexes measure spending on bundles of treatments for diseases rather than spending on individual treatments.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A new look at software prices; A new online Survey of Current Business

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Preliminary Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2008
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP declined 6.2 percent after declining 0.5 percent in the third quarter, reflecting a downturn in exports and a larger decrease in investment in equipment and software. The fourth-quarter estimate was revised down 2.4 percentage points from the advance estimate.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2009 Comprehensive NIPA Revision: Changes in Definitions and Presentations
row.Author: Eugene P. Seskin, Shelly Smith
row.Description: This comprehensive revision will change definitions and presentations to improve the national accounts' treatment of disasters and insurance services by government enterprises among other things.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Future Directions for the Industry Accounts
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: A look at planned improvements to these accounts, including the development of quarterly GDP by industry statistics and better integration between the annual industry accounts and the benchmark input-output accounts.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A new method to measure R&D output prices; Budget translation article coming in June

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Final Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2008
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 6.3 percent after decreasing 0.5 percent in the third quarter, reflecting a downturn in exports and a larger decrease in investment in equipment and software. Corporate profits fell 16.5 percent, the largest drop since the fourth quarter of 1953.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Fourth Quarter of 2008
row.Author: Debasis Chaudhuri
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $11.3 billion to –$658.9 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $17.5 billion to –$561.5 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $6.2 billion to –$97.4 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2008
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Fourth Quarter of 2008 and Year 2008
row.Author: Douglas B. Weinberg, Erin M. Whitaker, Gregory A. Tenentes
row.Description: The current-account deficit decreased to $132.8 billion from $181.3 billion in the third quarter, mainly reflecting a decrease in the deficit on goods. In 2008, the deficit decreased to $673.3 billion from $731.2 billion in 2007.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: Ann E. Dunbar, David G. Lenze, Charles Ian Mead, Nacola A. Alexander, Michelle A. Harder, Carrie L. Litkowski, Matthew A. von Kerczek, James M. Zavre, Alison M. Adam, H Steven Dolan, Gary V. Kennedy, Jonas D. Wilson, Kathy A. Albetski, Robert L. Brown
row.Description: State personal income statistics for the fourth quarter of 2008 and annual statistics for the year 2008, a look at regional multipliers, and a summary of three widely used measures of personal income.
row.Supp2_Title: Regional Multipliers: What Are They and How Are They Used

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Summary estimates of MNC activity, comprehensive revision info, FAQs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP declined 6.1 percent after declining 6.3 percent in the fourth quarter. While consumer spending turned up sharply, business investment fell more than in the fourth quarter, as did inventory investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2009 Comprehensive Revision of the NIPAs: Statistical Changes
row.Author: Clinton P. McCully, Steven Payson
row.Description: The fourth in a series of articles about the upcoming comprehensive revision, which is scheduled to be released July 31.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Andrew W. Hodge, Robert J. Corea
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations and industries and various Q ratios. In 2008, the profitability of nonfinancial corporations decreased for the second straight year.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Advance Statistics on GDP by Industry for 2008
row.Author: Donald D. Kim, Brian M. Lindberg, Justin M. Monaldo
row.Description: The slowdown in economic growth in 2008 reflected downturns in durable-goods and nondurable-goods manufacturing, retail trade, and finance and insurance.

row.Title: Local Area Personal Income for 2007
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Counties with populations of less than 100,000 fared the best in 2007; average growth accelerated to 7.5 percent from 5.0 percent in 2006. In larger counties, growth decelerated.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A new look at the 'great moderation', international research by special sworn employees.

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Preliminary Estimates for the First Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP fell 5.7 percent after falling 6.3 percent in the fourth quarter. Consumer spending turned up sharply, and business investment fell more than in the fourth quarter. Corporate profits increased $42.6 billion after decreasing $250.3 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Kyle D. Mulgrew
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $231.5 billion to –$904.6 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $254.8 billion to –$830.4 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $23.2 billion to –$74.2 billion
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2010 Federal Budget
row.Author: Benjamin A. Mandel, Bryan A. Williams
row.Description: Each year BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget
row.Supp1_Title: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts, 2005–2008
row.Author: Eric S. Griffith, Steven L. Zemanek
row.Description: The travel and tourism industry in 2008 shrank for the first time in 7 years, decreasing 1.8 percent after increasing 1.7 percent in 2007 and 2.9 percent in 2006. Employment also declined.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: A Primer on BEA's Industry Accounts
row.Author: Mary L. Streitwieser
row.Description: This introduction to the BEA industry accounts—which include the GDP by industry accounts and the benchmark and annual input-output accounts—looks at the computer and electronic products industry to show what kind of information is readily available.

row.Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States: New Investment in 2008
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: Outlays by foreign investors to acquire or to establish U.S. businesses rose 3 percent to $260.4 billion in 2008, the third largest on record after rising to $251.9 billion in 2007. The 2008 increase occurred despite a falloff of worldwide mergers and acquisitions and amid a slowing U.S. economy.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State for 2005–2008
row.Author: Caitlin E. Coakley, Daniel A. Reed, Shane T. Taylor
row.Description: Real gross domestic product (GDP) slowed in 38 states and all 8 BEA regions in 2008. The economy was weakest in the Great Lakes region and strongest in the Rocky Mountain region.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Travel spending in the first quarter, a new collection of articles on intangible assets and services.

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Final Estimates for the First Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP fell 5.5 percent after falling 6.3 percent in the fourth quarter. Consumer spending turned up sharply, and business investment fell more than in the fourth quarter. Corporate profits rose $48.1 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2009
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The International Investment Position of the United States at Yearend 2008
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$3,469.2 billion; in 2007, it was –$2,139.9 billion. U.S.-owned assets abroad rose $1,609.3 billion to $19,888.2 billion, and foreign-owned assets in the United States rose $2,938.6 to $23,357.4 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2008: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Marilyn Ibarra, Jennifer Koncz
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 8 percent after growing 18 percent in 2007. Foreign direct investment in the United States position also grew 8 percent after growing 15 percent in 2007.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Accounts
row.Author: Anne Flatness, Erin M. Whitaker, Robert E. Yuskavage
row.Description: Each year, statistics on U.S. international transactions are revised to incorporate updated data and various statistical improvements. The main improvement this year was a new treatment of disaster-related insurance losses.
row.Supp1_Title: The Statistical Discrepancy in Periods of Economic Turbulence

row.Title: Financial Derivatives
row.Description: Statistics on transactions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area or country for 2006–2008 and statistics on fair values of financial derivatives for 2007–2008.

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: Each year, the estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance-of-payments concepts and to close the gaps in coverage.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Douglas B. Weinber, Gregory A. Tenentes
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $53.4 billion to $101.5 billion, the smallest deficit since the fourth quarter of 2001. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $41.2 billion to $47.1 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income declined in 37 states in the first quarter of 2009. In all states, private sector earnings declined. Finance, durable-goods manufacturing, and construction were particularly weak.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Accounting for household production: another step

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP fell 1.0 percent after falling 6.4 percent in the first quarter. Business investment and exports fell less than in the first quarter, and government spending turned up. Consumer spending turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Initial Results of the 2009 Comprehensive Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Robert Kornfeld
row.Description: Comprehensive revisions, released roughly every 5 years, incorporate new, high-quality source data and changes in definitions and classifications that better capture the dynamic economy.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Defined Benefit Pensions and Household Income and Wealth
row.Author: Marshall B. Reinsdorf, David G. Lenze
row.Description: A discussion of accrual approaches to measuring defined benefit pension plans and the effect of these approaches on household income, wealth, and saving.

row.Title: U.S. Multinational Companies: Operations in the United States and Abroad in 2007
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Raymond J. Mataloni Jr.
row.Description: The value added of U.S. multinational companies increased 4.8 percent. The value added of U.S. parents increased 2.0 percent, and the value added of their foreign affiliates increased 11.6 percent.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA's Strategic Plan for 2009-2013

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP fell 1.0 percent after falling 6.4 percent in the first quarter. Business investment and exports fell less than in the first quarter. Consumer spending turned down. Corporate profits increased $67.6 billion after increasing $59.1 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Kyle D. Mulgrew, Mark S. Ludwick
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $300.1 billion to –$1,305.8 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $325.8 billion to –$1,294.9 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $25.7 billion to –$10.9 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Improved Estimates of the National Income and Product Accounts: Results of the 2009 Comprehensive Revision
row.Author: Eugene P. Seskin, Shelly Smith
row.Description: The picture of the economy shown by the revised estimates is similar to the picture shown by previous estimates.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: National Income and Product Accounts Tables
row.Description: Annual, quarterly, and monthly statistics from the 2009 comprehensive revision, second estimates for the second quarter of 2009, and preliminary estimates for July 2009.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: GDP and Other Major NIPA Series for 1929–Second Quarter of 2009
row.Description: Historical statistics on GDP and its components in current dollars, chained dollars, and chain-type quantity and price indexes, including statistics on national income and personal income.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Direct Investment for 2006–2008: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Capital and Income Flows
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: Statistics on (1) the direct investment positions and international transactions of U.S. and foreign multinational companies and (2) the composition of investment by U.S. companies abroad and foreign companies in the United States.
row.Supp2_Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States Tables

row.Title: Personal Income for Metropolitan Areas for 2008
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Growth in personal income slowed in 322 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas. It increased in 42 areas, remained unchanged in 2 areas, and fell in 5 areas.
row.Category: Regional, Personal income for metropolitan areas

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Travel spending, new online Newsroom, FAQs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP fell 0.7 percent after falling 6.4 percent in the first quarter. Business investment and exports fell less than in the first quarter. Consumer spending turned down. Corporate profits increased $43.8 billion after increasing $59.1 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Statistics on government spending by function, changes in the net stock of fixed assets, and a comparison of NIPA and USDA net farm income. All reflect the 2009 comprehensive revision of the NIPAs.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2006 to the Second Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Enrico Tan
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication. All reflect the 2009 comprehensive revision of the NIPAs.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Cross-Border Trade in 2008 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2007
row.Author: Jennifer Koncz-Bruner, Anne Flatness
row.Description: A look at U.S. international services, including cross-border trade and services supplied through affiliates. Statistics on services supplied through bank affiliates are included for the first time.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Second Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Douglas B. Weinberg
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $5.7 billion to $98.8 billion, the smallest deficit since the fourth quarter of 2001. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $22.9 billion to $58.3 billion.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area: Accelerated Statistics for 2008, New Statistics for 2007, and Revised Statistics for 2005–2007
row.Author: Matthew J. McCormick, Sharon D. Panek, Ralph M. Rodriguez
row.Description: Growth in real GDP by metropolitan area slowed in 220 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas, reflecting downturns in construction, manufacturing, and finance and insurance in many areas.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Updated government tables, Shiskin award

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.5 percent after decreasing 0.7 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending, inventory investment, exports, and residential investment turned up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Personal, household, and nonprofit income; BEA and IRS statistics on nonprofits; federal receipts and expenditures and the budget; state and local receipts and expenditures and Census Bureau data; and seasonally unadjusted statistics. All reflect the 2009 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real estimates of GDP and current-dollar estimates of gross domestic income, reflecting the 2009 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Fixed Assets and Consumer Durable Goods for 1999–2008
row.Author: David B. Wasshausen, Jennifer A. Bennett, Debasis Chaudhuri, Michael T. Cusick, Michael D. Glenn, Christopher B. Mbu, Nadia F.P. Sadée
row.Description: Statistics on the net stock of (1) equipment and software and of business and government structures and (2) consumer durable goods. Both reflect the 2009 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Fixed assets and consumer durable goods

row.Title: Operations of U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Companies: Preliminary Results From the 2007 Benchmark Survey
row.Author: Thomas Anderson, William J. Zeile
row.Description: Current-dollar value added of U.S. affiliates increased 1.9 percent, to $628.0 billion, in 2007, the smallest increase since 2001. Employment by affiliates increased for the third consecutive year.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: Robert L. Brown
row.Description: State personal income grew in 37 states in the second quarter of 2009. Statistics for 1969 through the first quarter of 2009 have been revised to incorporate the 2009 comprehensive NIPA revision.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Income and other taxes on MNCs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.8 percent after decreasing 0.7 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending, inventory investment, exports, and residential investment turned up. Corporate profits increased $130.0 billion after increasing $43.8 billion in the second quarter.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Third Quarter of 2009
row.Author: Kyle D. Mulgrew, Mark S. Ludwick
row.Description: Government transactions continue to be affected by the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 and by other programs aimed at providing capital to financial enterprises.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009

row.Title: Subject Guide for 2009
row.Description: A list of articles published in the Survey of Current Business in 2009.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2010
